Description: Squat jar; whitish calcite with horizontal banding; carved with flat base, two vestigal lug handles and a wide flat lip; polished surfaces; ink inscription in cursive Aramaic added later; repaired from three fragments.
Authority: Ruler: Artaxerxes (inscription purporting to be of)
Curator's comments: Naveh was the first scholar to question the authenticity of the inscription.
Bibliographic references: Searight, Reade & Finkel 2008a / Assyrian Stone Vessels and related material in the British Museum (531, pp.78-79, fig.52)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: Iranian Room [IR], case ?, no. 37. 1984 6 Oct-18 Nov, Switzerland, Lugano, Museo d'Arte moderna Villa Malpensata, Un’arte per la bellezza 1984 2 May-17 Jun, Italy, Padua, Palazzo della Ragione, Un Arte per la Bellezza : Cosmesi e Salute nei Secoli
